name: Sitcom Special Events : Marriages and Births Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: In "The Mary Tyler Moore Show", Georgette has a baby. Where?
questions.explanation:
Mary's apartment.

	With everyone present, of course. Good episode.

questions.text: Rhoda has trouble getting to her wedding because someone forgets to pick her up. Who?
questions.explanation:
Phyllis.

	Hence, we have Rhoda dashing through the streets of New York in her wedding dress.

questions.text: Rob Petrie has trouble getting to his wedding. Why?
questions.explanation:
He had car trouble.

	Flashback territory, as Rob recalls romance between a soldier and a USO entertainer.

questions.text: Rob Petrie also had trouble getting to the hospital when his son was born. From whom did he have to borrow clothing?
questions.explanation:
Buddy.

	He had to borrow Buddy's pants. (They didn't fit.)

questions.text: "Three's Company" ended with a wedding. How did Janet meet her husband?
questions.explanation:
At a lawyer's office.

	She met her husband (Philip) at a reading of a will at a lawyer's office.

questions.text: "Happy Days" also ended with a wedding. Whose wedding?
questions.explanation:
Joanie.

	Joanie and Chachi - setting up the spinoff show.

questions.text: Maxwell Smart became a father on "Get Smart". What was unusual about that?
options: Max didn't know that 99 was pregnant
A KAOS doctor performed the delivery in a KAOS hospital

questions.text: Inger Stevens got married on "The Farmer's Daughter". To Whom?
questions.explanation:
Her employer.

	She worked for William Windom - and ultimately married him. (Lucky guy.)

questions.text: "Cheers" ended with Woody marrying Kelly, but Rebecca also got married. To whom?
options: An old boy friend from back home
questions.explanation:
A plumber.

	Tom Berenger played the plumber - even though Rebecca had always pursued corporate types.

questions.text: Who gets married in "Kate and Allie"?
questions.explanation:
Allie.

	Allie marries ex-athlete turned sportscaster, Bob Barsky.
